intro: Libinhania balfourii, commonly known as the Balfour's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a waxy coating. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
